pr_title: Cherry pick fixes to support macros in joiner plugin

timeline.message: Cherry pick fixes to support macros in joiner plugin

timeline.author: CuriousVini
CuriousVini

replies.bodyText: Can we move this check to init as well?
replies.author: CuriousVini

replies.bodyText:
Fixed conf.OUTPUT_SCHEMA -> JoinerConfig.OUTPUT_SCHEMA.
The check doesn't belong in init because init is called from:

here, i.e. configurePipeline
prepareRun
initialize

Making this check at configure time is sufficient; IMO we don't need to check this again in other places.
replies.author: rmstar

timeline.author: CuriousVini
CuriousVini

replies.bodyText: looks like inputSchemasAvailable is called at many places. can we centralize that check in this method?
replies.author: CuriousVini

replies.bodyText:
Added @VisibleForTesting annotation.
inputSchemasAvailable is called from:

configurePipeline - part of check to verify that output schema is provided if input schemas are not known
prepareRun - don't record lineage if input schemas are not available
createOutputFieldInfos - bail out if input schemas are not available
JoinerConfig.validateJoinKeySchemas - part of check to skip validation if input schemas are not available or joinKeys is a macro.

Since it's used in many different contexts, I don't think it makes sense to centralize the check in init().

timeline.bodyText: we can make this method private

CuriousVini

replies.bodyText: the method can be package private
replies.author: CuriousVini

timeline.bodyText: !inputSchemas.isEmpty()  - this is same check as inputSchemasAvailable right?
timeline.author: CuriousVini

replies.bodyText:
It's a bit different: inputSchemasAvailable returns true if:

inputSchemas is not empty, and
None of the values (i.e. schemas) in inputSchemas is null.
replies.author: rmstar

replies.bodyText: I think we can use inputSchemasAvailable here like you suggested. will fix.
